title: Newsnight investigation CSCS cards
text: [news] 09:55 Speaking as a former H&S bod of many years out on sites, a lot of this "training" is in response to the burgeoning number insurance / compo claims that were won as a result of the IPs employer not being able to prove that they had "safe and competent" employees. There is an absolute requirement in the Health and Safety Act Work Act for this. As there is also in the Construction Design & Management Regs (and many more too)With the transient and multicultural workforce the building industry employs, there is really no other way than having a centrally administered system to carry out training and prove a minimum level of competence.There is also the issue of English as a second language and low (often non-existent) levels of literacy.As with any system (run on a shoestring) it is open to abuse. There are not enough folk employed by the principal contractors to do a proper job of checking up on the cards, so workers know they can get away with it.Similarly, dodgy providers will exploit any opportunity to make a quick buck.If the HSE were properly funded and had more experienced inspectors out on site, this would be cured quite quickly.
